Package io.github.jorgericovivas.rust_essentials

package io.github.jorgericovivas.rust_essentials
The following package adapts some of Rust features to Java, allowing to create more readable, maintainable, and secure code, the following features have been adapted this far:

- Option<T>: Represents optional values, where every Option is either Some<T> and contains a non-null value, or None when it contains no value.

- Result<T, E>: Represents the result of executing an operation, being either an Ok<T> containing a value, or Err<E> representing the operation couldn't finish due to some condition, and contains a value that usually tells information about what happened.

In Java, most of Err would usually contain Exceptions.

- Tuples represent collections of values of different types, like a tuple of three values such as Tuple3<String, Integer, Double>, but due to limitations, tuples can only be up to 7 values.


This is not in any way related to the real Rust programming language.

  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    io.github.jorgericovivas.rust_essentials.option
    Represent values optional value through two valid states, Some<ValueType> containing a value, and None containing no value.
    io.github.jorgericovivas.rust_essentials.result
    Represent the result of an operation that might fail using two valid states, Ok<ValueType> containing the value of the operation when it is successful, and Err<ErrorType> containing a value explaining what the error is and what happened.
    io.github.jorgericovivas.rust_essentials.tuples
    Represent collections of values of different types, like a tuple of three values such as Tuple3< String, Integer, Double>, but due to limitations, tuples can only be up to 7 values.
